duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage new product development projects in support of the overall plant objectives, delivering measurable results on schedule and on budget.
Create Process FMEAs to drive Control Plan and Work Instruction development.
Review engineering designs and changes to product development, ensuring timely and cost-effective sourcing or manufacturing.
Update inspection and manufacturing documentation and processes to support engineering changes.
Drive the development and validation of tooling and processes for reliable product production.
Troubleshoot to determine root cause and formulate appropriate corrective action, ensuring final process capability and stability.
Enter and maintain process routings, standards of work, sequence of events, and other documents controlled by the Manufacturing Engineering Department.
Design fixtures, tooling, methods of work holding, and methods of transportation as required for product manufacture.
Oversee the procurement and manufacture of required items, identifying and justifying capital equipment as needed.
Ensure workplace safety and organization (5-S), modeling values in the workplace and leading positively and optimistically.
Self-motivated, flexible, and able to work in a team environment with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Manufacturing, Industrial, Mechanical Engineering preferred – candidates with equivalent OTJ experience will be considered as well.
